author: Unity
description:
Getting the best performance for your game can depend heavily on the way you're using memory, and C#, while a language with many great features, wasn't initially designed around the performance needs of game developers. Understanding the way your C# code uses memory can unlock significant performance gains and provide deeper insights into your Unity projects.

In this session, we will cover:

- The structure of memory from the CPU's point of view, and how accessing one bool can cost 200X the time of accessing another
- How your C# objects can end up laid out in memory
- What's actually happening during those GC spikes, and how to reduce them
- Strategies for working with memory more directly

This session will provide a comprehensive introduction to these concepts, equipping you with foundational knowledge to identify significant performance optimizations and navigate the crucial considerations when working with ""low-level"" C#.

#Unity #Unite2025 #GameDev
title: Understanding Unity memory | Unite 2025

author: Unity
description:
Learn how to create immersive VR and MR experiences, optimize performance and graphics, and integrate platform-specific features like hand tracking and spatial audio. Get hands-on experience and expert insights to take your Unity knowledge into VR!

#Unity #Unite2025 #VR
title: Unlock the full potential of Meta Quest and Meta Horizon OS with Unity | Unite 2025

author: Unity
description:
The Unite 2025 Keynote took place November 19, 2025 in Barcelona, Spain, where we shared the latest tech, gamedev success stories, and exciting new partnerships with the Unity community.

Greater flexibility remained the central theme in a Keynote segment by SVP of Grow Felix The on how Unity Vector is powering user acquisition with intelligent matches between players and in-game ads. It draws upon insights from how developers build games and visibility across billions of player sessions around the world, driving around 15-20% increase in installs and up to 20% boost in in-app purchase spend by acquired players. Naveen Mawani, VP of Growth at Homa, also came onstage to share his team’s experience with Unity Vector for All in Hole, which helped the team double their percentage of players buying items and their spend.

#Unity #Unite2025 #UnityVector
title: Unity Vector | Unite 2025 Keynote
